page.title: 17The work people do
page.content: Fifteen 12-year olds, who live in the area, were asked the occupations of their parents. Those of the fathers showed a great diversity. Job descriptions were as follows: gas fitter, floor-layer, sales manager, sales representative for cigars and cigarettes, British Telecom, Club Steward, Qualified joiner, in insurance, stove enameller, school caretaker, freezer engineer, owner of hardware shop / Post Office. Only two of the mothers were just house wives. The rest had full or part time paid jobs. Three of these entailed full time work in partnership with their husbands, one as a business partner, one as Club stewardess, and the third in the shop /P.O. Others were: 3 cleaners, a caterer, 3 school cooks, a telephonist, an employee of a national newspaper, a printer.
